intro: Viola edulis, commonly known as the edible violet, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate, pentagonal flowers that come in shades of purple, violet, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil in partial shade. Its flowers and young leaves are edible, often used in culinary applications such as salads, teas, and desserts. Viola edulis is also valued for its ornamental beauty and traditional medicinal uses.
